p: Having explored these issues for a dozen years, it was with some confidence, and a deepening awareness that the global clock was ticking and that changes were accelerating, that we opened our 13 th volume in 2017 by providing recommendations to the (yet to be elected at time of writing) incoming United States president (Apitz, Attanasio et al. 2017). We suggested that they consider investments in science education; environmental protection; recognition of the interdependence of economic vitality, environmental quality, and social equity; as well as cross‐sectoral and global collaboration, to promote global security through sustainable ecological productivity.
